snippet: Remarks by Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, open the door to a riskier, more expansive American combat role than the president has publicly outlined.
abstract: Gen Martin E Dempsey, chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff, tells Senate Armed Services Committee that he will recommend deploying United States forces in ground operations against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria if airstrikes prove insufficient; statement opens door to riskier more expansive American combat role, although Pres Obma has ruled out sending American troops to fight militants on ground.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JEREMY W. PETERS
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Atlanta, and Eric Schmitt from Monterey, Calif.

lead_paragraph: Remarks by Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, open the door to a riskier, more expansive American combat role than the president has publicly outlined.

headline.main: U.S. General Open to Ground Forces in Fight Against ISIS in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. General Open to Ground Force as Option in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
